summary: middle east respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) has caused several hospital outbreaks, including a major outbreak at a 940-bed tertiary-care hospital in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. to learn from our experience, we described the critical care response of intensive care services to the outbreak. the total sick leave duration was 138 days for nurses and 30 days for physicians. 63 patients requiring organ support and prolonged ICU stay with a high mortality rate.
